Description: Necklace: a string of bright-blue glazed composition and shell disc beads and a single green glazed composition disc.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Mostagedda, grave 3248 Found in front of the knees of a woman.
Curator's comments: Some of the blue glazed composition beads were once sewn on leather (see G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 123, 125). Also from this burial: beads (1930,0711.345 & 1930,0711.342 & 1930,0711.344), necklaces (1930,0711.348 & 1930,0711.349 & 1930,0711.350 & 1930,0711.351), shell (1930,0711.347). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 120; Tomb register, pl. LXXI; Bead register, pl.LXXIB.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (627)
